description: Automatic routing depending on routers into a folder tree. Like on a highway you do not care about how the engine works to go to a an exit. You just turn left or right while exploring new branches of the road! This will provide you with a road'map' for sure as destinations (index.js exporting a router)! are retrieving from a folder architecture. An autoroute is a a highway in French ;)

scripts.build: npm run remove-dist && npm run compile && npm run declare-types && npm run bundle && npm run declare && npm run min && npm run remove-temp &&npm run end-bld
scripts.dev-build: npm run remove-dist npx rimraf dist && npm run compile && npm run extract-temp && npm run end-dev-bld
scripts.extract-temp: cp -r ./dist/TEMP/ ./dist/ && npm run remove-temp && npm run end-ext-tmp
scripts.remove-temp: npx rimraf dist/TEMP && npm run end-rmv-tmp
scripts.remove-dist: npx rimraf dist && npm run end-rmv-dist
scripts.declare: npx -p typescript tsc dist/TEMP/index.bundle.js --declaration --allowJs --emitDeclarationOnly --outDir dist && mv dist/index.bundle.d.ts dist/index.d.ts && npm run end-declare
scripts.declare-types: npx -p typescript tsc src/types.ts --declaration --allowJs --emitDeclarationOnly --outDir types && npm run end-declare-types
scripts.end-ext-tmp: echo '[\x1b[32m✔\x1b[37m] \x1b[32mTEMP folder has been extracted from its content\x1b[37m'
scripts.end-rmv-tmp: echo '[\x1b[32m✔\x1b[37m] \x1b[32mdist/TEMP folder is deleted from now\x1b[37m'
scripts.end-rmv-dist: echo '[\x1b[32m✔\x1b[37m] \x1b[32mdist folder is deleted from now\x1b[37m'
scripts.end-declare-types: echo '[\x1b[32m✔\x1b[37m] \x1b[32mTypes declaration have bean generated into dist\x1b[37m'

name: mz-autorou-ts
